As per the report, the audience of the screening will include Cabinet Ministers, senior politicians and high-ranking bureaucrats. The film is directed by Padma Shri recipient Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi and marks the debut of Manushi Chhillar.

176.title: All 3 teams above RCB will be wary of them in playoffs: Irfan
176.article_body: Speaking about RCB, who were the last team to qualify for playoffs in IPL 2022, Irfan Pathan stated that all three teams, GT, RR and LSG, above RCB are wary of Faf du Plessis-led side now. "They (RCB) are coming on the back of an emphatic win in their previous game," he added. They'll face LSG in Eliminator on Wednesday.

177.title: J&K LG meets Kashmiri Pandits protesting over Rahul Bhat's killing
177.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Monday met Kashmiri Pandits protesting over the killing of government employee Rahul Bhat, who was killed by terrorists on May 12. One of the primary demands of the protesters is posting of Kashmiri Pandits working for J&K administration outside Kashmir. "Instructions have been issued to move you to safer locations," Sinha told the protesters.

178.title: 11 killed in late-night shootings in 2 bars in Mexico, handwritten signs left
178.article_body: Eleven people were killed in simultaneous shooting attacks on two bars in north-central Mexico, authorities said on Tuesday. Handwritten signs left at the scenes of the killings suggested the attacks were part of a rivalry between two drug cartels that have been battling for control of Guanajuato state for several years. Eight of the victims were women.

179.title: Raj CM approves proposal to eliminate job interviews for most services
179.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has approved the elimination of job interviews from the recruitment process for most services. Interviews will continue for posts under Rajasthan State and Subordinate Services (Direct Recruitment by Combined Competitive Examination) Rules, 1999, among some other posts. According to a statement, amendment in the rules will bring transparency in the recruitment process.

180.title: Nepotism hasn't worked in my favour, talent rules in this age: Adhyayan
180.article_body: Actor Adhyayan Suman, who is the son of actor Shekhar Suman, said, "Nepotism hasn't ever worked in my favour." He further stated that debate over nepotism in Bollywood has "always been futile". "Today, Kartik Aaryan receives as much love for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' as Alia Bhatt receives for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Talent and content rule supreme in this age," he added.

181.title: Colombia soldiers to train Ukrainian military on landmine removal
181.article_body: Colombia's Defence Minister Diego Molano Aponte on Monday said that a team of Colombian soldiers will travel to Europe to train Ukraine's military on techniques to remove landmines. The experts from Colombia, which is a NATO partner, were invited to give the training by the US, he added. Colombia is one of the world's most-mined countries, according to the UN.

182.title: Assam CM visits flood-hit district Dima Hasao, reviews situation
182.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma visited state's flood and landslide-hit Dima Hasao district and reviewed the situation there on Tuesday. Sarma visited relief camps set up at schools in district's Haflong, where 80 houses were destroyed due to torrential rains earlier this month. At least 24 people died and over 7 lakh others were affected due to floods in Assam.

183.title: Mahindra honoured at US college where his father was the 1st Indian graduate
183.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra was honoured with the Dean's Medal at Tufts University's The Fletcher School, 75 years after his father Harish Mahindra became the first-ever Indian graduate of the college. Sharing pictures from the ceremony, Mahindra said, "In the 75th year of Indian Independence, I was honoured to be the first Indian to address the School's Class Day."

184.title: Rubbish, it's 10-yr-old story: Sumona on rumoured wedding with Samrat
184.article_body: Actress Sumona Chakravarti, reacting to rumours of her wedding with Bengali actor Samrat Mukerji, called them "rubbish", adding that these are "10-year-old stories from social media". The actress further said that she will make an announcement if there is any such development in her life. "Frankly, no comments, I don't like to talk about my personal life," Sumona added.

185.title: J&K govt removes Sheikh Abdullah's photograph from police medals
185.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) government has decided to remove the photograph of National Conference (NC) founder and ex-CM of the erstwhile state of J&K Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah from the J&K Police Medals for both gallantry and meritorious service. The J&K state emblem has also been removed from the medals. Abdullah's photograph will be replaced with the Indian government's National Emblem.

186.title: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa shares picture getting MRI scan
186.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa, who portrays 'Aquaman', shared a picture of himself getting an MRI scan. He wrote, "You got to break some eggs to make an omelette." The actor is doing "okay" and got the MRI as "a precaution", reported People. Jason earlier had surgery to remove a hernia one day before appearing on the 94th Academy Awards red carpet.

187.title: Saudi Arabia reports limited progress in talks with Iran
187.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud on Tuesday said that there had been limited progress in talks with Iran. The Saudi minister also said that Saudi Arabia's hands remain outstretched to Iran. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two regional rivals.

188.title: People in B'wood thought I was too skinny & said 'make her fat': Madhuri
188.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that people in Bollywood thought that she was "too skinny" when she joined the industry. "During my time...they thought I was too skinny, to begin with. 'Yeh heroine, isko thoda mota karo (make this heroine a little fat)', they used to say," Madhuri stated. "I don't think that that's an issue now," she further added.

189.title: 'Manchester United are rubbish' appears on screen during broadcast, BBC blames trainee
189.article_body: The BBC has apologised after a message appeared during a broadcast on its news channel saying 'Manchester United are rubbish'. The channel blamed a trainee for the gaffe, with a presenter saying that the mistake had occurred as someone was learning how to operate the ticker and was "writing random things not in earnest".

190.title: India has immense talent, but one has to look hard to find it: Ganesh
190.article_body: Choreographer-actor Ganesh Acharya has said that there is "immense talent" in India. "But one has to look hard enough to find these hidden gems," he added. "I have also struggled in my younger years and was given an opportunity that has made me the Ganesh Acharya that I'm today," he further said. Ganesh will next be seen in 'Dehati Disco'.

191.title: World lost 11.2 crore jobs in first quarter of 2022: ILO report
191.article_body: The number of hours worked globally in the first quarter of 2022 dropped to 3.8% below the employment situation before the pandemic, a report by International Labour Organisation (ILO) revealed. The report said this is equivalent to a deficit of 11.2 crore full-time jobs. It cited fresh lockdowns in China, Ukraine-Russia conflict and inflation as the reasons for the findings.

192.title: Pics of Chinese & Russian jets near Japan during PM Modi's Quad meet released
192.article_body: Japanese Defense Ministry on Tuesday released the pictures of Chinese and Russian fighter jets that flew near Japanese airspace during the Quad meet, which was also attended by PM Narendra Modi. Japan conveyed "grave concerns" to Russia and China through diplomatic channels. A Russian TU-95 bomber, Chinese H-6 bombers and Russian IL-20 information gathering warplane were reportedly among the jets.

193.title: The richer someone is, the fewer kids they have, I'm an exception: Musk
193.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Contrary to what many think, the richer someone is, the fewer kids they have." The 50-year-old father of seven children said he's "a rare exception", adding that "most people I know have zero or one kid". Musk earlier said that the belief that having fewer children is better for the environment is "total nonsense".

194.title: J&K Police bust Jaish-e-Mohammed module in Awantipora, arrest 8
194.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police along with security forces busted a terror module of proscribed terrorist outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) in Awantipora by arresting eight terrorist associates. Police have also recovered incriminating materials, including ammunition, from their possession. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

195.title: Pakistani govt bans ex-PM Imran Khan's protest march to Islamabad
195.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah on Tuesday announced a ban on a planned protest march by ex-PM Imran Khan and his supporters to the country's capital Islamabad. The ban was announced after a policeman was killed during a crackdown on Khan's supporters across the country. "No one would be allowed to siege the capital and dictate his demands," Sanaullah said.

196.title: 3 Delhi tourists including 2 siblings drown in Ganga in Rishikesh
196.article_body: Three tourists from Delhi, including a brother-sister duo, drowned in Ganga river in Shivpuri on Uttarakhand's Rishikesh-Devprayag stretch on Tuesday. According to State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) officials, the deceased were part of a nine-member group of tourists. The incident took place when the three persons went to bathe in the river, where water level had increased due to rainfall.

197.title: GT skipper Hardik hasn't looked fully fit while bowling in IPL 2022: Kaif
197.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Mohammad Kaif said GT captain hasn't looked fully fit while bowling in ongoing IPL, adding he hasn't bowled in every match. "Hardik not bowling regularly is a cause for concern because when he's selected for India, it's as an all-rounder," he added. Hardik was named in India's T20I squad for upcoming five-match series against South Africa.

198.title: AAP's CM face in Goa polls Amit Palekar to head state committee
198.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday announced that its chief ministerial candidate in the recently-held Goa Assembly polls, Amit Palekar, will head the party's new committee in the state. Additionally, AAP MLAs Capt Venzy Viegas and Cruz Silva will serve as the working presidents of the executive committee. AAP won two seats in the Goa elections.

199.title: Video shows Tesla car on fire in Canada, driver says 'had to break window to escape'
199.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Tesla Model Y on fire in Vancouver, Canada. According to the car's owner Jamil Jutha, the car lost power and shut down after warning of an "error". Jutha claimed the car started filling up with toxic smoke coming through vents, prompting him to break the window to escape as the doors wouldn't open.

200.title: My father's death was the single biggest learning experience of my life: Rahul
200.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said the death of his father and the former PM of India Rajiv Gandhi was "the single biggest learning experience" of his life. His father's death caused him "tremendous pain", Rahul said, adding, "But...I can't get away from the fact that [it] also made me learn things that I would never ever have learnt otherwise."

201.title: Pic shows UK PM Boris Johnson drinking at party during lockdown in the country
201.article_body: Photographs of UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson drinking at a Downing Street gathering when the country was under lockdown have emerged. The photos, published by ITV News, show Johnson proposing a toast with a group of people next to a table with several bottles of alcohol and party food. They were taken at an event in November 2020, ITV said.

202.title: UP man arrested for sending obscene pictures to female Mumbai doctor
202.article_body: A 24-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly sending obscene pictures to a female doctor employed at a hospital in Mumbai's Bandra, police said on Tuesday. Police are on the lookout for the accused's accomplice, who is a former ward boy of the hospital. Police found the accused was using his younger brother's phone for the crime.

203.title: Sports and cinema have the power to unite India: Ayushmann Khurrana
203.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that sports and cinema have the power to unite India. "I have closely seen how sports brings people together in celebration and I have also witnessed how cinema can be the unifier of audiences," he said. "They transcend identities and evoke the feeling of being one in that moment," he added.

204.title: 5 people die after consuming suspected spurious liquor in Bihar
204.article_body: At least five people died after they allegedly consumed suspected spurious liquor in Bihar's Aurangabad district, an official said on Tuesday. According to Aurangabad SP Kantesh Kumar Mishra, all deaths have been reported from the Madanpur block. Police have destroyed many illegal distilleries and arrested 67 suspected bootleggers following the incident, Mishra said.

205.title: BESCOM assures waiver of fixed electricity charges to B'luru hotels
205.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has assured waiver of fixed electricity charges to hotels and restaurants in Bengaluru. The waiver of fixed electricity charges was extended to hotels and restaurants during COVID-19 pandemic for a period of three months from April-June 2021. Meanwhile, BESCOM has provided 11 WhatsApp helpline numbers for consumers to lodge complaints.

206.title: RR peaking at right time, GT's performances have gone down: Kaif
206.article_body: Ahead of Qualifier 1 between GT and RR in IPL 2022, Mohammad Kaif said RR are peaking at the right time and GT's performances have gone down in the last few matches. "They (RR) are learning to win matches even without major contributions from Jos Buttler," he added. GT have lost three of their last five matches.

207.title: Argentinian Prez, First Lady pay $24,000 fine over lockdown party
207.article_body: Argentinian President Alberto Fernández and First Lady Fabiola Yáñez on Monday paid a fine of 30 lakh pesos (about $24,000) over a birthday dinner during a COVID-19 lockdown. Notably, the fine will be donated to Argentina's Malbran Institute, a prestigious vaccine research institute. The gathering amid social restrictions had sparked a scandal in the country.

208.title: India suffer their first defeat in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey, lose 2-5 to Japan
208.article_body: India on Tuesday suffered their first defeat in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey after losing 2-5 to Japan. Japan scored in the 24th, 40th, 49th, 54th and 56th minutes, while India's goals came in the 45th and 50th minutes. Pawan Rajbhar and Uttam Singh scored for India. India will next face Indonesia on Thursday.

209.title: Raj man files domestic abuse complaint after wife beats him with bat
209.article_body: A man in Rajasthan's Alwar has filed a domestic abuse complaint against his wife, accusing her of beating him with a cricket bat. A local court has directed police to probe the case and make security arrangements for the man, who alleged that his wife frequently beats him for no reason. The couple has been married for nine years.

210.title: HC seeks Delhi Police reply on Punjab's plea to quash Bagga abduction FIR
210.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday sought the response of Delhi Police on a plea by Punjab Police seeking to quash an FIR against them for allegedly abducting BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga. Punjab Police had on May 6 arrested Bagga from his Delhi residence on a complaint alleging that Bagga had threatened CM Arvind Kejriwal during a protest.

211.title: India considers tax cut on soybean and sunflower oils: Report
211.article_body: India is considering cutting an import levy on soybean and sunflower oils amid surging prices of food, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday. The government is weighing whether to reduce the agriculture infrastructure and development cess, currently at 5%, or abolish it, the report said. A decision on the matter could be taken this week, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying.

212.title: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna gets ₹3.12 crore demand notice from SEBI
212.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has issued a notice to NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna asking her to pay ₹3.12 crore in a case related to governance lapses at the stock exchange. The SEBI has warned Ramkrishna of arrest and attachment of assets and bank accounts if she fails to pay the penalty amount within 15 days.

213.title: GT to bowl first against RR in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1, playing XIs announced
213.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the Qualifier 1 of IPL 2022 at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. GT have made one change to their playing XI, with Alzarri Joseph replacing Lockie Ferguson. RR are fielding an unchanged side.

214.title: Ex-Maha BJP MLA booked for ‘disproportionate assets’ worth ₹8 cr
214.article_body: Officials said the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has registered an FIR against former BJP MLA Narendra Mehta and his wife, Suman, for allegedly having "disproportionate assets" worth ₹8.25 crore. The ACB, in its complaint, stated that while serving as an MLA from Mira-Bhayandar Vidhan Sabha seat and corporator of MBMC, Mehta misused his official positions and amassed illegal assets.

215.title: BJP criticises Rahul for meeting 'anti-India' British MP; Cong replies
215.article_body: The BJP on Tuesday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for meeting British MP Jeremy Corbyn, who is known for his "anti-India" and "anti-Hindu" remarks and for advocating the separation of Kashmir from India. Meanwhile, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala, while sharing a picture of PM Narendra Modi with Corbyn, asked, "Does it mean PM has endorsed Jeremy Corbyn's views on India?"

216.title: Lack of protection was my biggest wound in relationships: Jada Pinkett
216.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith said lack of protection was her "biggest wound" in all her relationships. "I've looked for [the] craziest kind of protection, and I don't have a really good sense of what's safe and what's not," she added. In March, Jada's husband Will Smith had slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars over a joke on Jada's shaved head.

217.title: Umran can become an asset for India, needs to be used effectively: Sehwag
217.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has called Umran Malik a "special talent", saying the SRH pacer can become an "asset" for the Indian team after he was included in India's 18-member squad for T20I series against South Africa. He added Umran needs to be used "carefully" and "effectively" by  captain KL Rahul for the upcoming five-match T20I series.

218.title: Unlike shakhas, madrasas teach empathy: Owaisi on Assam CM's remarks
218.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over his madrasa comments saying, "unlike Shakhas, they [madrasas] teach self-respect and empathy." Owaisi further tweeted, "Obsessing over Muslim ancestry shows your inferiority complex. Muslims have enriched India and will continue to do so." Earlier, the Assam CM said madrasas should cease to exist.

219.title: Taliban announces deal with UAE firm to manage Afghan airports
219.article_body: Taliban on Tuesday announced a deal with a UAE firm to manage three airports in Afghanistan after the fall of the country's US-backed government last year. Under the deal, UAE's GAAC Solutions will manage the airports in Herat, Kabul and Kandahar, the Taliban said. This move comes amid Taliban's past negotiations with Turkey and Qatar on the management of airports.

220.title: Punjabi language test made mandatory for Group C & D posts in Punjab
220.article_body: The Punjab government on Tuesday said it will now be mandatory for those applying for Group C and D posts to clear a Punjabi language test with at least 50% marks. The decision has been taken to promote the state language, as per an official statement. It was decided by Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann in a meeting.

221.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' fame Disha Vakani welcomes second child
221.article_body: Actress Disha Vakani, known for portraying Dayaben in television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', recently welcomed her second child. Her husband Mayur Padia and brother and former co-star Mayur Vakani have confirmed the news. Pictures of the actress' baby bump had gone viral in December. Disha and Mayur got married in 2015 and welcomed their first child in 2017.

222.title: Fashion designer jumps to death from building in Gurugram
222.article_body: A 25-year-old fashion designer allegedly jumped to death from the 14th floor of Gurugram's Valley View Estate, police said on Tuesday. The deceased, Charu Khurana, was a native of Haryana's Karnal and had moved to Gurugram in search of a job. Prima facie, it appears to be a case of suicide but we're probing all angles, a police official said.

223.title: Abhay calls Kashyap 'gaslighter' after director said he was 'difficult to work with'
223.article_body: Abhay Deol has called filmmaker Anurag Kashyap a "gaslighter" in an interview. Without taking anyone's name, Abhay revealed how he didn't like marketing himself, as he wanted the film to speak for itself. However, he mentioned he was "gaslit" into thinking he didn't care enough for the film. Previously, Anurag said it was "painfully difficult" to work with Abhay.

224.title: Velocity record highest successful chase in Women's T20 Challenge history, beat Supernovas
224.article_body: Deepti Sharma-led Velocity recorded the highest successful chase in Women's T20 Challenge history by chasing down a target of 151 against Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas on Tuesday. Opener Shafali Verma and Laura Wolvaardt scored 51(33) and 51*(35) respectively for Velocity, while their bowler Kate Cross recorded figures of 4-0-24-2. Velocity will face Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers on Thursday.

225.title: Chinese, Russian fighter jets fly nearby as PM Modi meets Quad leaders in Japan
225.article_body: Japan on Tuesday expressed "grave concerns" over Chinese and Russian fighter jets carrying out a patrol near its airspace as PM Narendra Modi met other leaders of the Quad group in Tokyo. The planes, however, did not breach Japan's territorial airspace, its Defence Ministry said. It called the patrol "provocative" in light of the Quad regional security summit.

226.title: ₹24.5 lakh cash stolen from a parked car in Navi Mumbai mall
226.article_body: The Vashi Police have registered a case after ₹24.5 lakh cash was stolen from a car parked in the parking lot of Inorbit Mall. Police said that the complainant, a businessman, parked the car and went shopping with his wife. When he returned, he found that the bag with the cash was missing and the rear window glass was broken.

227.title: Gurugram records 73.4mm rainfall in 24hrs, highest in May in 25yrs
227.article_body: Gurugram received 73.4 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours, the highest rainfall the city has received in May in 25 years. The previous highest rainfall for May was recorded at 53 mm in 1987, said Manmohan Singh, Director, India Meteorological Department, Chandigarh. "The entire state recorded heavy rainfall on Monday, but it was largely significant in Gurugram," Singh added.

228.title: Zomato shares record best day since market debut, close 14% higher
228.article_body: Shares of homegrown food delivery startup Zomato on Tuesday recorded their best day since the stock market debut in July last year. Zomato shares closed 14.72% higher on NSE on Tuesday after soaring 18% during intraday trading. The company's shares gained despite Zomato reporting a net loss of ₹359.7 crore for the fourth quarter, while its revenue surged 75% year-on-year.

229.title: Uttar Pradesh Assembly pays tribute to singer Lata Mangeshkar
229.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly paid tributes to singer Lata Mangeshkar who passed away in February this year. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath expressed grief and said, "The art and music world has suffered an irreparable loss with the passing away of Lata Mangeshkar." Members of the Assembly also remembered 11 former members of the Legislative Assembly, who passed away recently.

230.title: Viral pic shows PM Modi walking in front of US Prez, Australian PM; ministers react
230.article_body: A picture showing PM Narendra Modi walking in front of US President Joe Biden and Australian PM Anthony Albanese at the QUAD meet is going viral on social media. Reacting to the image, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "Pradhan Sevak- knows the way, goes the way, shows the way." "Leading from the front...our PM," said Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.

231.title: Ajay Devgn's name cleared from'De De...' false advertisement case
231.article_body: A consumer forum in Rajasthan's Ajmer has granted relief to Ajay Devgn by clearing his name in the false advertisement case against 2019 film 'De De Pyaar De'. The complainant is suing the film's makers, saying that the stunt on a poster was not performed in the film. The court has ruled that actors have nothing to do with posters.

232.title: People dying in floods but Assam CM busy with hate speech: Owaisi
232.article_body: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's 'madrasa' remark, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "18 people have died in Assam and seven lakh have been affected due to floods, but he's (Himanta) busy with hate speech." "They (BJP)...have hate for Islam and Muslims," he added. Earlier, Himanta had said, "Admitting children in madrasas is a violation of their human rights."

233.title: 2 dead, 120 injured in gas cylinder blast in Abu Dhabi restaurant
233.article_body: A gas cylinder explosion in a restaurant in United Arab Emirates' Abu Dhabi has killed two people and injured 120 others, the police said on Monday. The blast set off a fire that damaged the facades of six buildings before being brought under control, they added. Four of the damaged buildings were safely evacuated, they further said.

234.title: Johnny Depp gave me CPR after I overdosed in 1995: Courtney Love
234.article_body: Singer Courtney Love revealed actor Johnny Depp saved her life outside the Viper Room in 1995. Courtney's friend Jessica Reed Kraus shared a series of videos on Instagram in which the singer said she doesn't want to make her judgments on Depp's defamation trial publicly. "Johnny gave me CPR in 1995 when I overdosed outside the Viper Room," Courtney added.

235.title: Adani Green to invest ₹60,000 crore in Andhra, create 10,000 jobs
235.article_body: Adani Green Energy has signed an MoU with Andhra Pradesh government to set up projects worth around ₹60,000 crore in the state. The renewable energy company will set up a 3,700 MW pumped storage hydro power plant and a 10,000 MW solar power project. The projects are expected to create direct and indirect employment for 10,000 people.

236.title: Assam custodial death victim's wife, 4 others booked under UAPA
236.article_body: Assam Police has arrested six persons, including the wife and daughter of a fish trader who allegedly died in police custody, for allegedly burning down a police station. The other accused are also relatives of the deceased, Nagaon SP said. Police said five of the six accused have been booked under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for suspected terror links.

237.title: Policeman killed, his 7-yr-old daughter injured in terrorist attack in Srinagar
237.article_body: A policeman was killed and his seven-year-old daughter was injured after terrorists opened fire at them in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, police said. Saifullah Qadri succumbed to his injuries while being taken to the hospital while his daughter has been hospitalised, they added. The attack took place in Soura area of Srinagar.

238.title: Credit to RR for showing faith in Ashwin's all-round abilities: Harbhajan
238.article_body:
Crediting RR for showing faith in Ravichandran Ashwin's all-round abilities in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said it's the "best" franchise to have ever made full use of the bowling all-rounder.  
"No franchise has ever utilised Ashwin's batting talent before but this team has promoted him up in the batting order and he's won them a match with...bat," he added.

239.title: Beggar buys ₹90,000 bike after wife complains of backache in MP
239.article_body: A man from Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district spent his life savings to buy a bike worth ₹90,000 after his wife complained of backache from sitting on a tricycle they own. The man, identified as Santosh Kumar Sahu, stated that the couple can now travel to various locations in their new vehicle. Sahu, who's reportedly physically disabled, earns money through begging.

240.title: Parents of sexual offence victim can't enter into compromise with accused: High Court
240.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has said that parents of a child who is a victim of a sexual offence cannot enter into a "compromise" with the accused. "Parents cannot be allowed to compromise the dignity of a child by an agreement," the court asserted. The court was hearing a petition seeking quashing of an FIR registered under POCSO Act.

241.title: Mumbai Police chief to interact live with citizens on social media
241.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey will interact with citizens during a live session on Facebook and YouTube on Wednesday evening, Mumbai Police said on Twitter. Pandey will discuss policing-related issues with the common people and listen to their complaints during the live session. Notably, Pandey conducts a Facebook live session every Sunday.

242.title: Police issue traffic advisory ahead of PM Modi's visit to Hyd
242.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory for commuters ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the Indian School of Business (ISB) in Hyderabad on May 26 (Thursday). Reportedly, police have also banned the use of remotely controlled drones or para-gliders or remotely controlled microlight aircraft within a five-kilometre radius of the ISB and the Gachibowli Stadium.

243.title: One of the things I'm allowed to do at home is buy TVs: SRK
243.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has stated that he doesn't disrupt the design at his house since his wife Gauri Khan "is a wonderful designer". He said, "One of the...things that I'm allowed to do...[is] that whenever I go and buy a television, (I can) put it in any room." He added it's because he knows technology the best at home.

244.title: Ajay Kothiyal, who was AAP's Uttarakhand CM face, joins BJP
244.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party's CM candidate for recently-held Uttarakhand Assembly elections Ajay Kothiyal on Tuesday joined the BJP in Dehradun. He joined the party in the presence of Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami. Kothiyal, a retired Colonel, had resigned from AAP on May 18. He had contested the Assembly polls from the Gangotri Assembly constituency.

245.title: Drones used to trace Delhi engineer found dead in 500-ft gorge in Pune
245.article_body: Police used drones to locate a 24-year-old engineer from Delhi who went missing in a forest area near Lonavala last week. His body was found at a depth of 500 feet in a gorge near Duke's Nose Point. NDRF, INS Shivaji naval station in Lonavala, Pune Rural Police and some local groups were searching for him for last three days.

246.title: 200 bodies found in rubble of building in Ukraine's Mariupol
246.article_body: Ukrainian authorities on Tuesday said that workers digging through rubble have found 200 bodies in Mariupol. The bodies, which are in a state of decomposition, have been found in the basement of a collapsed apartment building, an adviser to Mariupol's mayor said. Recently, the Russian forces completed their takeover of the city, which has suffered extensive damage during the war.

247.title: 200+ challans issued for drunk driving in Noida, Greater Noida in a day
247.article_body: Police said 2,365 vehicles were checked and challans were issued to 215 people who were allegedly found driving in drunk condition in Noida, Central Noida and Greater Noida areas on Monday. "Senior police officers had also hit the ground to lead foot marches for inspection in...busy areas of district including markets...near shopping malls, metro stations...key roads and junctions," police added.

248.title: Housing prices rise by up to 11% across 8 cities in Jan-Mar: Report
248.article_body: A joint report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said housing prices rose by up to 11% YoY across eight major cities between January and March 2022. Housing prices in Delhi-NCR witnessed the highest rise of 11% to ₹7,363/square feet, followed by Hyderabad with a 9% rise to ₹9,232/square feet. Ahmedabad saw an 8% rise to ₹5,721/square feet.

249.title: Pic of Aishwarya Rai's ₹1,500 modelling bill from 1992 surfaces
249.article_body: A picture of the bill Aishwarya Rai charged for appearing in a fashion catalogue in 1992 was shared by a Bollywood account on Reddit. The bill specifies that Aishwarya, who was 'aged about 18 years' at the time, 'agreed to work as a model' for a firm called Krupa Kreations. It carries her signature at the bottom.

250.title: Instagram unveils new logo, rolls out custom typeface 'Instagram Sans'
250.article_body: Instagram on Monday unveiled a new logo with a "vibrant gradient" and introduced a new typeface called 'Instagram Sans' as part of a "visual refresh". Instagram said the new gradient has been "reimagined using an innovative 3D modelling process". The new typeface is inspired by Instagram's logo as well as a combination of squares and circles, or "squircles", Instagram added.

251.title: SC stays NGT order imposing over ₹15 cr fine on Coca-Cola bottler
251.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed a National Green Tribunal order imposing a penalty of over ₹15 crore on Coca-Cola bottling unit Moon Beverages. Earlier this year, the NGT had found Moon Beverages guilty of exploiting groundwater for bottling plants in UP's Greater Noida and Sahibabad. As per the petitioner, the extraction was being done in an indiscreet and arbitrary manner.

252.title: Finland, Sweden to send teams to Turkey to discuss NATO bids
252.article_body: Finland and Sweden will send delegations to Turkey to try to resolve Ankara's opposition to their applications for membership of NATO, Finnish Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto said. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan had earlier said neither country should bother visiting to try to convince Turkey of their bids. Sweden and Finland cannot join the alliance without the support of all members.

253.title: Dayaben to return to 'Taarak...', not sure about actress: Producer
253.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumar Modi has stated that the character of Dayaben will be returning to the television show after four years. The character was portrayed by actress Disha Vakani. Asif added that Disha is now married and has a kid and it's uncertain if the character will be portrayed by her or a different actress.

254.title: Babar would've been a top IPL star, picked by MI for highest amount: Akhtar
254.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said Pakistan captain Babar Azam would have been a top star in the IPL, adding MI would have picked him for the "highest" amount. Akhtar stated that Pakistan opener Mohammad Rizwan would have been signed by RCB because Virat Kohli needs a team man. "As an opener, Rizwan would have made a greater impact for RCB," he said.

255.title: Won't spare even our own leaders: Kejriwal as Mann sacks AAP minister
255.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state minister Vijay Singla over corruption allegations, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said AAP "won't spare" even its own leaders if found involved in corruption. "No one knew about this corruption, neither the media nor Opposition. Had CM Mann wanted, he would've asked for a slice of it with a 'setting'," the AAP chief added.

256.title: The South Indian film industry has always existed: Abhay on North-South debate
256.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol commented on the ensuing North-South debate and said, "The South Indian film industry has always existed and has always had their audience." "Now, there's a bit of mish-mash happening because you realise, oh 'Baahubali looks great', or 'This actor looks interesting, let's take him in a different language movie' and vice-versa," he added.

257.title: We have set the bar very high for 'Salaar': Vijay Kiragandur
257.article_body: Vijay Kiragandur of Hombale Films said they've set the bar high for 'Salaar'. "On one hand, we have Prabhas, who's the hero of...(Baahubali 2) and on the other hand, we've Prashanth Neel and Hombale, who made the second-biggest film of India (KGF 2)," he added. "This is a deadly combination and it's going to be a big challenge," he said.

258.title: 5 time former Guj Cong MLA's son joins BJP along with supporters
258.article_body: Late Gujarat Congress leader Anil Joshiyara's son, Keval, joined the BJP along with around 1,300 supporters in Bhiloda, Arvalli on Tuesday. Anil, who passed away in March 2022 due to COVID-19, was elected five times as an MLA from the tribal region in North Gujarat. Notably, Gujarat BJP President CR Paatil was present to welcome Keval to the party.

259.title: Urge public to remain alert: CRPF DIG on Amarnath Yatra
259.article_body: Security arrangements have been made at the place where pilgrims will stay during the Amarnath Yatra, Rajendra Prasad, DIG CRPF, said. "I urge the public to remain alert and inform the security personnel if they see any anti-social element," Prasad added. "Additional deployment is being done. We've drawn outline-details of deployment already made in main sensitive areas," Prasad stated.

260.title: Daniel Vettori appointed assistant coach of Australian men's cricket team
260.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has been confirmed as one of the Australian men's team's new full-time assistant coaches. Vettori has been appointed to the permanent position following a stint with the team during the white-ball leg of the Pakistan tour. Andre Borovec has also been appointed one of the assistant coaches.

261.title: What will happen if rain washes out IPL 2022 playoffs?
261.article_body: Number of overs in IPL 2022 playoffs can be reduced to five per side at maximum in case of rain interruption. In case that isn't possible, a Super Over will be played to determine the winner. If Super Over is also not possible, team that finished highest on the points table will be declared the winner of that particular match.

262.title: Boat carrying tourists capsizes in Maharashtra, 2 dead
262.article_body:
A boat carrying nearly 20 tourists capsized in the Arabian Sea off the Malvan coast in Maharashtra's Sindhudurg district on Tuesday, killing two people. One more person is in critical condition. The deceased persons were from Pune and Akola, officials said, adding
that the tourists were returning after scuba-diving.

263.title: Fawad Khan gave me a tough time on 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai': Sheheryar
263.article_body: Pakistani actor Sheheryar Munawar revealed Fawad Khan gave him a tough time while shooting 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai'. The interviewer asked if Fawad bullied him. To this, Sheheryar said, "It was a different kind, not the bullying we see on television." "Fawad was tough on me...the fear of being there on set, it was...a difficult time for me," he added.

264.title: Russian offensive in Donbas biggest since World War II: Ukraine
264.article_body: The Russian offensive in the Donbas region of Ukraine is a "ruthless battle, the largest one on European soil since World War II", Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said. Kuleba also urged Ukraine's allies to speed up the supply of weapons and ammunition to the country, especially multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS), long-range artillery, and armoured personnel carriers (APCs).

265.title: Hope Buttler retains orange cap but doesn't score in Qualifier 1: Tewatia
265.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler ahead of GT-RR Qualifier 1 match in IPL 2022, Buttler's ex-RR teammate and GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he hopes the RR opener retains the orange cap but doesn't score against GT. "He is as calm off the field as he's aggressive with the bat," he added. Buttler has scored 629 runs in 14 matches so far.

266.title: 6 students test COVID-19 positive at Anna University in Tamil Nadu
266.article_body: Six students at the Anna University campus in Tamil Nadu's Guindy have tested positive for COVID-19. Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan said a cultural event had taken place at the university. When a woman who participated in the event had few symptoms, she got tested and was found to be positive for COVID-19.

267.title: I was surprised, suffered with him: Suarez on Messi's Barcelona exit
267.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Lionel Messi's exit from Barcelona after 21 years, former Barcelona striker Luis Suarez said, "I was surprised and...suffered with him because he was also surprised." "We had been on vacation a few days before and he said...[he'll renew on Thursday]. [Messi's wife] Antonela informed my wife on Thursday afternoon that he did not renew," added Suarez.

268.title: Boeing's Starliner to return to Earth on May 26, NASA to provide live telecast
268.article_body: Boeing's CST-100 Starliner spacecraft will complete the Orbital Flight Test-2 mission and depart from the International Space Station at 12.06 am IST on May 26 for a landing in the western United States. NASA will begin the live coverage of the event on May 24 on NASA Television, NASA App and the agency's website.

269.title: Ekta said 'You'll be next sex bomb on TV', I laughed: Urvashi on Komolika
269.article_body: Talking about her famous character of Komolika, actress Urvashi Dholakia said Indian television producer Ekta Kapoor told her that she is going to become the next sex bomb of television industry. She added that she laughed at this. "I didn't have anything in mind back then...I was like 'I need to work...I have to fend, I have responsibilities'," she added.

270.title: SRK attends event in Delhi; does his signature open arms pose, pics surface
270.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan was in Delhi for a promotional event on Tuesday, where he greeted fans with his signature 'open arms pose'. The actor wore a black suit with a white shirt and completed the look with a pair of black sunglasses. The actor's manager took to Instagram to share pictures of Shah Rukh, and captioned them, "Delhi diaries."

271.title: Cong always trying to damage faith of Hindus: Hardik Patel
271.article_body: Hardik Patel, who has recently quit Congress, said that the Congress party works to hurt the sentiments of people and is always trying to damage the faith of the Hindu religion. His statement came after he alleged that a senior Gujarat Congress leader had said that dogs urinate on bricks being used for building the Ram temple in Ayodhya.

272.title: Gurugram Police arrests 2 sharpshooters, recovers ₹7 lakh
272.article_body: Two sharpshooters carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh each were arrested by the Gurugram Police recently. The police have also recovered a foreign-made pistol and ₹7 lakh from the two accused. The two accused, belonging to the Kaushal gang, had shot dead an auto driver in Gurugram's Feroz Gandhi Colony on February 22 last year, according to the police.

273.title: BESCOM provides WhatsApp numbers for consumers to lodge complaints
273.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company has provided WhatsApp helpline numbers for consumers to lodge complaints regarding power-related issues. This comes as the existing helpline number of BESCOM 1912 has been flooded with complaint calls by citizens. Karnataka Energy Minister V Sunil Kumar had instructed BESCOM to provide WhatsApp numbers to all eight districts of its jurisdiction.

274.title: Aditya Birla Fashion to sell 7.5% stake to GIC to raise ₹2,195 cr
274.article_body: Aditya Birla Fashion on Tuesday said its board has approved raising up to ₹2,195 crore by selling a minority stake of 7.5% to Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund. Investments will be raised by way of preferential issuance of equity and warrants to an affiliate of GIC. After the transaction, Aditya Birla Group will hold 51.9% stake in the company.

275.title: Officials to install banners welcoming Amarnath pilgrims: Kashmir official
275.article_body: The officials have been directed by Divisional Commissioner, Kashmir, Pandurang K Pole, to install banners welcoming Amarnath Yatra pilgrims in all panchayats, villages and municipal areas along the Yatra route. "Also share different samples of welcome banners...by May 27 for approval of Divisional Commissioner, Kashmir," the order issued by Pole stated.

276.title: Nikki, Aadhi Pinisetty host wedding reception in Chennai, pics surface
276.article_body: Nikki Galrani and Aadhi Pinisetty hosted a reception in Chennai, which was attended by many celebrities from the film industry including Radhika Sarathkumar, Naseer, Aishwarya Rajesh, Arnav Vijay and Ilaiyaraaja. The couple tied the knot on Thursday in the presence of their family and friends. The wedding was attended by actors Nani and Sundeep Kishan.

277.title: Chennai transforming into a 'city of killings': AIADMK leader
277.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Tuesday alleged that Tamil Nadu's capital Chennai is transforming into a 'city of killings'. Chennai alone witnessed 18 murders in 20 days, Palaniswami said, adding that a question mark hangs over people's security. He further blamed CM MK Stalin, who holds the police portfolio, for 'not improving' law and order situation in the state.

278.title: OYO shelves plan to launch IPO in 2022: Report
278.article_body: Hospitality and travel-tech firm OYO is shelving plans to launch its IPO in 2022, Bloomberg reported. If OYO picks up the plan to launch the IPO before the year-end, the earliest possibility for the launch would be in 2023. PTI, however, reported on Tuesday that OYO plans to launch the IPO at a reduced valuation of $7-8 billion post-September.

279.title: Mini Defence Expo to be held in Kolkata for first time from July 6-9
279.article_body: On Tuesday, the Eastern Army Commander Lieutenant General RP Kalita announced that a Mini Defence Expo will be held for the first time in Kolkata from July 6-9 this year. "It (Mini Defence Expo) will give the MSMEs and start-ups in the defence sector a good opportunity to showcase their products," General Kalita said.

280.title: Undersea 'shark volcano' is erupting, says NASA; shares satellite pics
280.article_body: Satellite pictures shared by NASA have shown an eruption of the famous 'sharkcano' (shark volcano), which is a submarine (underwater) volcano in the Solomon Islands. Two species of sharks have been found living in the acidic waters of the submerged crater. The pictures have shown "a plume of discoloured water being emitted" from the Kavachi Volcano, NASA said.

281.title: When we studied engineering there was no girl in our class, it seemed so bad: Bihar CM
281.article_body: While inaugurating a hostel in Magadh Mahila College, Patna, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said, "When we studied in engineering college, there was no girl in our class...it seemed so bad." He added, "Whenever any woman came, students used to gather in large numbers to see her. Now see how many girls are studying in engineering and medical colleges."

282.title: People kept asking me 'Why aren't you doing films like Lust Stories': Sanjay
282.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said he is definitely getting better offers and opportunities now. "You have to be patient. For example, you start getting better offers after you prove yourself with one project. For me, it was 'Lust Stories'," he added. "People kept on asking me 'Why aren't you doing films like that?'," Sanjay said.

283.title: Mark Ruffalo joins Pattinson in 'Parasite' director Bong's next sci-fi film
283.article_body: Actors Mark Ruffalo, Toni Collette and Naomi Ackie have joined the cast of Bong Joon Ho's upcoming directorial set at Warner Bros. The sci-fi feature, also starring Robert Pattinson, is based on the novel Mickey7, written by Edward Ashton. Bong's 2019 film 'Parasite' won multiple awards at the 92nd Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

284.title: Suhana celebrates her 22nd b'day with Khushi Kapoor on 'The Archies' sets
284.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan on Tuesday shared a few pictures from her 22nd birthday celebration on the sets of her debut film, 'The Archies'. In one photo, Suhana can be seen posing alongside Khushi Kapoor. For her birthday, she donned an orange bodycon dress and also shared pictures of the bouquets she received on her special day.

285.title: BJP denies ticket to BS Yediyurappa's son for upcoming MLC polls
285.article_body: The BJP announced its candidates for the upcoming Karnataka MLC elections in which the party denied ticket to BJP leader BS Yediyurappa's son, Vijayendra Yeddyurappa, who is the present State Vice President of the party. The Karnataka BJP core committee had earlier recommended over a dozen names as probable candidates, including Vijayendra, for the MLC polls, reports said.

286.title: Indian Army rescues 12 people from overturned mini-bus in Leh
286.article_body: The Indian Army rescued 12 passengers, including five children trapped inside an overturned mini-bus in Leh and provided necessary medical assistance, a Defence spokesperson said. The vehicle had overturned after it collided with another mini-bus on the Shyok-Durbuk road on Monday. A team of 12 soldiers returning from Durbuk witnessed the accident and swung into action to rescue the civilians.

287.title: RJ Umar from Kashmir receives Immunisation Champion award by UNICEF
287.article_body: A Radio Jockey from south Kashmir, Umar Nisar, also known as RJ Umar, has been awarded the '01 Best Content Award' and the Immunisation Champion award by UNICEF at the annual Radio4Child 2022 Awards in Mumbai. The Radio4Child felicitated radio professionals from All India Radio and private FM channels across India for their work during COVID-19 and for routine vaccination.

288.title: Vagheri hill to be declared eco-sensitive area: Goa Forest Minister
288.article_body: A file has been moved to declare Goa's Vagheri hill as an eco-sensitive area, state Forest Minister Vishwajit Rane said. He also shared the hill's pictures, adding that they show how it has been "cleared from the top". He further said that he will instruct his department to use satellite and Google imagery to monitor eco-sensitive areas every 15 days.

289.title: Cyberabad Police bust gang manufacturing fake phenyl
289.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Monday took to Twitter to inform that the police have busted a gang, which was illegally manufacturing fake phenyl, acid chemicals and floor cleaning chemicals. According to the police, the gang was busted after they received credible information about the racket. Police have further arrested the gang members for carrying out illegal activities without permission .

290.title: Aus-India ties have never been closer: PM Albanese at Quad summit
290.article_body: On the sidelines of Quad summit in Tokyo, newly-elected Australian PM Anthony Albanese praised his country's ties with India, claiming that they have "never been closer". "Warmly welcomed my meeting with [PM Narendra Modi] for an engaging discussion on Australia and India’s full strategic and economic agenda, including on clean energy technology," he tweeted. PMO described the talks as "fruitful".

291.title: The way Akshay spoke about being rejected for 'Jo Jeeta...' was derogatory: Maker
291.article_body: Director Mansoor Khan has reacted to Akshay Kumar's old interview wherein he had revealed that he was rejected during the audition for 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'. "Screen test diya maine...And they didn't like it. [Apparently], I was crap," Akshay had said. Mansoor said, "The way he has spoken about being rejected...is very derogatory and condescending...I never said he was crap."

292.title: Depp's behaviour that of intimate partner violence: Psychiatrist
292.article_body: Psychiatrist Dr David Spiegel testified against Johnny Depp on Monday in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard over her 2018 op-ed claiming to survive domestic abuse. "Depp has behaviours that are consistent with someone that both has substance use disorder as well as behaviours of someone who is a perpetrator of intimate partner violence," Spiegel stated.

293.title: Russia is not chasing deadlines in Ukraine: Top security official
293.article_body: Nikolai Patrushev, the Secretary of the Russian Security Council, said that Russia "isn't chasing deadlines" in Ukraine. "All the goals set by the President [Vladimir Putin] will be fulfilled. It cannot be otherwise, because truth, including historical truth, is on our side," he added. Patrushev also said that Ukraine was being used by the West to contain Russia.

294.title: GT head coach Ashish Nehra jokingly kicks RR's Chahal, GT share pic
294.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) took to Twitter to share a picture of their head coach Ashish Nehra jokingly kicking Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal. "Absolutely kicked to have Yuzi and Nehraji bless us with this moment," GT captioned the post. GT will face RR in IPL 2022's Qualifier 1 tonight at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

295.title: Russia's biggest mobile operator starts selling used phones amid inflation
295.article_body: Russia’s biggest mobile operator MTS has started selling discounted and used smartphones amid inflation and Western brands suspending shipments. While Apple has paused all product sales in Russia due to the Ukraine war, sales of Chinese smartphone brands doubled in the first two weeks of March in Russia. "This is a good opportunity for our company," said an MTS official.

296.title: Delhivery shares close 10% higher on first day of trading, m-cap hits ₹38,851 cr
296.article_body: Shares of logistics startup Delhivery closed 10.11% higher on their first day of trading on Tuesday. The stock ended at ₹536.25 on the NSE, after listing at a premium of 1.7% over an issue price of ₹487 per share. The Gurugram-based startup, which had raised ₹5,235 crore through its IPO, held a market capitalisation of ₹38,851 crore on Tuesday's close.

297.title: Russian envoy to UN resigns over 'bloody, witless' Ukraine war
297.article_body: A Russian envoy to the UN in Switzerland, Boris Bondarev, said he resigned from his post over the Ukraine war. He said he raised concerns about the Russian invasion with senior embassy staff but was told "to keep my mouth shut in order to avoid ramifications". He said he cannot share in "this bloody, witless and absolutely needless ignominy".

298.title: Potable water supply in NDMC area reduced by 60%: Civic body member
298.article_body: New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) Member Kuljeet Singh Chahal has written to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal claiming that the drinking water supply to NDMC area has been reduced by up to 60%. Chahal said that in the last 10 days, NDMC has been supplied 60-70 million litres per day (MLD) compared to the average of 125 MLD it usually receives.

299.title: Would have scored 10,000-plus Test runs had I not been dropped in 2007, it hurt: Sehwag
299.article_body: Recalling getting dropped from India's Test side in 2007, Virender Sehwag said that on realising that he was not part of the side, it hurt him. "I would have ended with 10,000+ Test runs had I not been dropped for that period," Sehwag added. Sehwag played just one Test in 2007 before making a comeback in 2008.

300.title: AAP has zero-tolerance against corruption: Punjab CM after sacking min
300.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, who sacked Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla from the state cabinet over corruption charges, said that his party has zero-tolerance policy against corruption. "I took [the matter] very seriously. Nobody knew about it, had I wanted it, I could have brushed it under the carpet. But I would have broken the trust of people," Mann said.

301.title: In a bid to get refund of ₹578 from IRCTC, Mumbai man loses ₹1.78 lakh
301.article_body: A man lost ₹1.78 lakh to a cyber fraudster while he was trying to get a refund of ₹578 from Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC). An FIR was registered at Tardeo police station. Reports said that the man searched for IRCTC's helpline number online and got connected to cyber fraudster. He extorted man's bank details and cheated him.

302.title: At 25, we predicted how our journey should end: Haasan on Rajinikanth
302.article_body: Discussing his 40-year friendship with actor Rajinikanth, actor Kamal Haasan said, "Rajini and I are competitors and friends at the same time. When we both were 25, we predicted how this journey of ours should end." "We are living...with the respect that it deserves," added Haasan. "You keep switching sides and shouting at each other. Not us," he stated.

303.title: Weibo bans Trip.com co-founder who questioned China's COVID-19 strategy
303.article_body: Chinese social media platform Weibo has banned Trip.com Co-founder James Liang who had questioned China's zero-COVID strategy, accusing him of violating laws. Liang had authored an article published on a think tank's WeChat account in which he argued that overly cautious epidemic prevention policies could inflict bigger pain on the economy. Weibo did not specify which laws Liang had broken.

304.title: New dinosaur species that lived 72 mn years ago discovered in Japan
304.article_body: Researchers have identified a new species and genus of dinosaurs from fossils unearthed in Japan's Hokkaido. Named Paralitherizinosaurus japonicus, these (mostly) plant-eating dinosaurs lived about 72 million years ago. They belonged to a family of small to large theropod dinosaurs called Therizinosauridae. Belonging to a new taxon, these dinosaurs had distinct characteristics in limbs and claws.

305.title: Over 3,000 bike riders booked for using banned multi-toned horns in Hyd
305.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police has registered cases against over 3,000 bike riders for using banned multi-toned horns and air horns. It has also imposed a fine of ₹1,000 on them. Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) AV Ranganath said charge sheets would be filed in the court against owners of such vehicles from June onwards and the violators will also face prosecution.

306.title: 5-yr-old girl sexually assaulted at Mumbai school; 51-yr-old peon held
306.article_body: A 51-year-old peon in a school was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a five-year-old girl in Mumbai's Mulund, police said. The incident took place when the victim, who lived in the locality, arrived to play at the school ground on Monday, police added. He lured her with chocolate, took her to a room and allegedly sexually assaulted her, police stated.

307.title: 2 IIMs make it to world's top 50 colleges for executive education in FT ranking
307.article_body: Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad and IIM Bangalore have made it among the top 50 colleges for executive education, occupying the 39th and 45th places in Financial Times (FT) latest ranking. The executive education custom FT ranking also featured the Indian School of Business, Hyderabad (38th rank), apart from IIM Ahmedabad (50) and IIM Bangalore (43).

308.title: Feeling of India call up yet to set in: Arshdeep Singh
308.article_body: Punjab Kings pacer Arshdeep Singh has said that the feeling of getting selected in India's T20I squad for the series against South Africa is yet to set in. "Really happy that I've been selected...Came to know about it in the team bus," Arshdeep said. "I want to keep performing to the best of my ability in the future," he added.

309.title: Depp's reaction as psychiatrist says 'Isn't Marlon Brando dead?' viral
309.article_body: Psychiatrist Dr David Spiegel, while testifying in trial, said he was aware Johnny Depp used an earpiece for his lines while filming. Depp's lawyer then asked David if he knew Marlon Brando also used an earpiece. To this, David replied, "Isn't he dead?" Depp covered his face with his hand after David's statement. Depp's reaction went viral on social media.

310.title: Agent leaks 'Aquaman 2' spoilers during Depp-Heard testimony
310.article_body: Agent Kathryn Arnold, while testifying in the ongoing defamation trial filed by Johnny Depp against ex-wife Amber Heard, revealed plot points of 'Aquaman 2'. Arnold said that Heard's character Mera was "injured somehow or it had something to do with a baby". She further said that Mera "ends up in the hospital early in...movie and doesn't...come out until the end".

311.title: Arrangements made to protect wild animals during floods: Assam Minister
311.article_body: The Assam Forest Department has made all preventive arrangements to protect wild animals during floods, said state Forest Minister Parimal Suklabaidya. "We'll introduce a time card for all vehicles to restrict vehicular speed on roads...passing through national parks and wildlife sanctuaries," the minister said. Rescue teams have also been formed for Kaziranga National Park, he added.

312.title: We're focusing on developing ties with China: Russia Foreign Min
312.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said the country would consider offers from the West to re-establish ties and determine "whether we'll need it or not", but for now will focus on developing relations with China. Russia will count on "only ourselves and on countries which have proved themselves reliable and do not 'dance to some other piper's music'", he added.

313.title: Deity at Qutub Minar survived without worship for 800 years, let that continue: Court
313.article_body: While hearing a petitioner seeking to worship Hindu deities within Qutub Minar complex, a Delhi court observed, "The deity has survived for 800 years without any worship. Let them survive like that." The Archaeological Survey of India maintained that even though images of Hindu and Jain deities were used in Qutub Minar complex's construction, revival of worship can't be allowed.

314.title: SC agrees to hear Azam's plea on Jauhar University demolition threat
314.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear a plea filed by SP leader Azam Khan this week, against the impending threat of demolition of Mohammad Ali Jauhar University, as part of the condition of his bail. A senior advocate, appearing for Khan, mentioned the matter for urgent hearing before a bench of Justices DY Chandrachud and Bela M Trivedi.

315.title: Defending champion Djokovic enters 2nd round at French Open
315.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated Japan's Yoshihito Nishioka 6-3, 6-1, 6-0 in the first round of men's singles at the French Open on Monday. Earlier, 13-time champion Rafael Nadal beat Australia's Jordan Thompson 6-2, 6-2, 6-2. In the women's singles, world number one Iga Swiatek posted a 6-2, 6-0 victory over Ukrainian Lesia Tsurenko in 54 minutes.

316.title: Nothing Hindu about wanting to murder, beat up people: Rahul
316.article_body: While being questioned about how Congress would fight 'Hindu nationalism', party leader Rahul Gandhi said that there is "nothing" Hindu and nationalist about the term, reported PTI. He added that he's studied Hinduism in "enough detail" and there's "absolutely nothing Hindu about wanting to murder people and beat people up". Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University's Corpus Christi College.

317.title: 11-yr-old's rare birth cataract treated under govt scheme in Pune
317.article_body: An 11-year-old girl in Pune suffering from a rare cataract defect since birth was treated free of cost under a government scheme at district civil hospital. The girl, Snehal Shivram Warye, was previously unable to read and write due to problems with her vision, her school teacher said. Snehal, who was also given free post-operative care, can now see better.

318.title: Paresh, Revathi to star in film adaptation of Ray's Golpo Bolo Tarini Khuro
318.article_body: Satyajit Ray's short story 'Golpo Bolo Tarini Khuro' is being adapted into a film. Titled 'The Storyteller', the film will star Paresh Rawal, Adil Hussain, Revathi and Tannishtha Chatterjee. Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who will direct 'The Storyteller', said that the team is "happy and honoured" to introduce the master storyteller to the younger generation with the upcoming film.

319.title: Pak govt says will hold polls in August 2023, not before: Report
319.article_body: The Pakistani government led by PM Shehbaz Sharif has rejected his predecessor Imran Khan's demand to hold elections early, according to a report quoting sources. The ruling PML-N reportedly said the elections would be held in August 2023, after the completion of the ongoing term. Notably, Khan is planning a protest march to Islamabad seeking dissolution of the National Assembly.

320.title: FB selfie helps B'luru police to arrest murder accused after 5 yrs
320.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested a 35-year-old murder accused, Madhusoodhan alias Madhu, who was on the run for five years. According to police, Madhu's friend had recently posted a selfie of them on Facebook, which led to his arrest. Madhu and his associates allegedly killed a retired bank manager to rob a diamond necklace worth crores in 2014.

321.title: Brought tears: Kejriwal after Mann dismisses Punjab Health Minister
321.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state Health Minister Vijay Singla following corruption charges against him, Delhi CM and AAP founder Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Proud of you Bhagwant. Your action has brought tears to my eyes." Singla was demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, Punjab CM's Office said. Singla was later arrested by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch.

322.title: Pawan Kalyan, ex-wife attend son Akira's high school graduation, share post
322.article_body: Actor Pawan Kalyan and his ex-wife Renu Desai attended their 18-year-old son Akira Nandan’s high school graduation ceremony. On Monday, Renu and Pawan shared a family photo featuring  Akira. Alongside the post, Renu wrote, "An era ends and an era begins. Proud parents of an amazing boy on his graduation day...I have told Akira that his true journey begins now."

323.title: Had pre-jitters; Cannes is big, you pray you don't fall, step on dress: Nargis
323.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that she had jitters before walking the red carpet at Cannes. "I was a little stressed about walking the red carpet as walking for Cannes is a big thing. You want everything to work out. You are praying that you don't fall or step on your dress or that any mishaps happen," she added.

324.title: Too bad, I'm never letting you go: Farah shares pic with Shirish on his b'day
324.article_body: Farah Khan Kunder took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish her filmmaker-husband Shirish Kunder on his 49th birthday. Sharing a few pictures, she wrote, "Too bad, I'm never letting you go...Happy birthday Shirish (pics 2&3 will explain why)." The first picture features Farah and Shirish, while the second and third pictures feature Shirish with his kids, Czar, Diva and Anya.

325.title: Exams of non-agriculture universities in Maha to be held offline: Minister
325.article_body: The examinations of non-agriculture universities in Maharashtra will be held offline, said state Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant on Tuesday. "If we keep conducting the exams online, it would raise a question mark on whether the industry would accept such students," Samant said, adding that the decision has been taken by vice-chancellors of 13 non-agricultural universities.

326.title: Bengaluru civic body begins training doctors on treating monkeypox
326.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started imparting training to doctors on treating monkeypox. As per reports, healthcare workers are being trained to look for symptoms of the viral disease. Besides this, the daily testing for COVID-19 will be scaled up from 11,000 to 15,000, according to BBMP Special Commissioner (Administration) S Rangappa.

327.title: UP teacher submits fake graduation marksheet to get job, booked
327.article_body: A teacher of an inter-college in UP’s Muzaffarnagar has been booked for allegedly submitting a fake document in order to get a job, police said. He was posted as an assistant teacher at Arvind Inter College in Muzaffarnagar district, police added. His graduation marksheet was found to be fake, following which an FIR was lodged on Monday.

328.title: Kangana trolled over failure of 'Dhaakad', Richa says 'People are expressing dissent'
328.article_body: Richa Chadha said those trolling Kangana Ranaut on the failure of 'Dhaakad' are "expressing dissent in whatever way they can". She was replying to tweets by Tehseen Poonawalla, wherein he criticised trolls "celebrating" its failure. However, Richa also wrote that it's "morally wrong because thousands of people work on a film", while adding, "But also, it happens. And to everyone."

329.title: India's 1st  self-driving cars startup Minus Zero raises $1.7 million in funding
329.article_body: India's first startup building affordable fully self-driving cars, Minus Zero, has raised $1.7 million in a seed round led by Chiratae Ventures with participation from JITO Angel Network and senior executives from American chipmaker NVIDIA and US-based ride-hailing service Lyft. The startup was founded by Gagandeep Reehal and Gursimran Kalra in 2021 while they were still students.

330.title: Sri Lanka seeks $500 million loan from India for purchase of petroleum products
330.article_body: Sri Lanka is seeking a $500-million loan from the Export-Import Bank of India (India Exim Bank) to purchase petroleum products amid severe economic crisis. Sri Lanka on Tuesday raised petrol and diesel prices by record 24.3% and 38.4%, respectively. On Monday, India delivered around 40,000 metric tonnes of petrol to Sri Lanka, days after supplying 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel.

331.title: Anything related to sex still remains to be a taboo in society: Ram Gopal Varma
331.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he was disappointed when some theatres refused to screen his lesbian film 'Khatra'. He added, "Anything related to sex still remains to be a taboo [in society]." "Even today, despite the Supreme Court repealing section 377, nearly four and a half years back, I don't think people are willing to talk about it," Varma said.

332.title: Playing in India, where my parents were born, is great opportunity: Alana King
332.article_body: Australian spinner Alana King, who is currently playing for Supernovas in the Women's T20 Challenge said playing in India is a "great opportunity" for her. "To play in a country where my parents were born and raised is absolutely a great opportunity for me. I could not say no to this," said King after winning against the Trailblazers on Monday.

333.title: Meta's Zuckerberg sued over Cambridge Analytica privacy breach
333.article_body: Meta's billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg has been sued by the District of Columbia over the Cambridge Analytica scandal, a privacy breach of millions of Facebook users' personal data. The lawsuit seeks to hold Zuckerberg personally liable for the breach, maintaining that he directly participated in important company decisions and that he was aware of potential dangers of sharing users' data.

334.title: Pune youth arrested over contact with terror operatives in J&K
334.article_body: Pune unit of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Tuesday arrested a man, in his early 20s, from the Dapodi area for his alleged contact with terror operatives from Jammu and Kashmir. The accused, identified as Junaid Mohammed, was connected with them through phone messenger groups, officers said. He had also received ₹10,000 for terror-related activities from them, officers added.

335.title: Virtue of subsidy only if it's swift & for short run: Piyush Goyal
335.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal, during a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said the "virtue of subsidy is only when it's swift and in the short run". "Our approach isn't going to be driven by subsidies...It's going to be...focused on structural reform and ease of doing business," he stated while urging Indian businesses to be "more proactive".

336.title: My mother once cried seeing my bruised face, said no one would marry me: Boxer Nikhat
336.article_body: World champion boxer Nikhat Zareen has revealed that her mother started shivering and crying after seeing her bruised face following her first sparring session. Nikhat added that her mother then told her that no one would marry her. "I replied, 'Don’t worry, once I make a name for myself, grooms will queue up at the doorstep'," Nikhat stated.

337.title: 'If you fall asleep, it's ok', says Biden jokingly to new Australia PM at Quad meet
337.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday welcomed newly-elected Australia PM Anthony Albanese to his first Quad meeting and praised him for making the long journey to Japan, right after being sworn in. Biden told Albanese, "You were sworn in and got on a plane...if you fall asleep while you're here, it's okay, because I don't know how you're doing it."

338.title: Mumbai Police shares 'Panchayat 2' meme asking people to avoid triple ride
338.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police shared a meme on its Twitter handle using 'Panchayat' season 2 dialogue asking people to avoid riding triple seat. In its post, the Mumbai Police shared the reaction of a 'Responsible Citizen' when their friends ask them to go for a ride triple seat and quoted the dialogue, "Ye sab mein comfortable nahi hun mai."

339.title: I kill criminals, not children & elders like Putin: Philippine Prez
339.article_body: Outgoing Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte criticised Russian President Vladimir Putin over the deaths of civilians in Ukraine. "Many say that Putin and I are both killers...But I kill criminals, I don't kill children and...elderly," Duterte said. This is the first time that Duterte, who calls Putin an idol and a friend, voiced his rebuke over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

340.title: TRAI's KYC-based caller ID plan won't be a competitor: Truecaller
340.article_body: Truecaller CEO Alan Mamedi in response to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) planning to develop a KYC-based caller ID system said, "We do not see that this would be a competitive service comparable to the full range of services and functionality that Truecaller offers." The proposed service could be a "driving catalyst" for the company's growth, he added.

341.title: Goods worth lakhs of rupees destroyed after fire at Noida building
341.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a commercial building in Noida on Monday, destroying goods worth several lakhs of rupees, police said. Over 10 shops in the complex caught fire, which took around three hours to be doused, said Arun Kumar Singh, Chief Fire Officer of Gautam Buddha Nagar district. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident.

342.title: Ghaziabad civic body seeks ₹491 cr in pending funds from state govt
342.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation is seeking ₹491 crore in pending funds from the state government as it seeks to carry out developmental work. Officials said that dues are pending on account of infrastructure development funds, which the civic body earns when residents take up sale deeds and pay stamp duties. The civic body is in dire need of funds, councillors said.

343.title: Heritage block at Hyd's Osmania Hospital won't be demolished: Owaisi
343.article_body: The century-old Osmania General Hospital's heritage block will be protected by the Telangana government while building new infrastructure. Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi said, "The hospital's heritage building won't be demolished but restored." He added that a new building will also be constructed while not obstructing the view of the heritage building and it is likely to cost nearly ₹560 crore.

344.title: Mental health report must before giving death sentence: Supreme Court
344.article_body: Supreme Court has ruled that all courts will now be required to call for an accused's mental health report and monitor their behaviour in jail before giving a death sentence. This will establish the person's frame of mind at the time of the crime, it added. SC was hearing an appeal made by three death row convicts from Madhya Pradesh.

345.title: Private tutor arrested from UP for kidnapping Thane girl student
345.article_body: A 35-year-old private tutor has been arrested from his residence in Uttar Pradesh for abducting his 13-year-old girl student from Thane. The accused was traced using Global Positioning System (GPS) 20 days after the girl went missing. The accused told police that he had kidnapped the girl by seducing her and convincing her that he loved her.

346.title: US oil price drops below $110 mark on global recession fears
346.article_body: US oil price fell below the $110 mark on Tuesday amid fears of a possible global recession and China's COVID-19 curbs affecting supply. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell 72 cents to $109.57/barrel, Brent crude fell 56 cents to $112.86/barrel. Price of Brent crude earlier hit $139/barrel in March this year, its highest since 2008.

347.title: 24-year-old missing Delhi engineer found dead in Lonavala forest
347.article_body: Pune police said on Tuesday that body of 24-year-old Delhi engineer, Farhan Serajuddin, who went missing in Lonavala forest near Pune on May 20, has been traced. Authorities, including NDRF, were coordinating operations to retrieve his body. Farhan, who had gone to Lonavala for trekking, had contacted his family to inform them that he lost his way before becoming untraceable.

348.title: Nawazuddin gets Excellence in Cinema Award at French Riviera fest
348.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui received the Excellence in Cinema Award at the French Riviera Film Festival. He received the honour from two-time Emmy award-winning actor Vincent De Paul. Sharing pictures on social media, Nawazuddin wrote, "Receiving the [award] made the wonderful evening...more special. Memorable time spent with the amazing Cinema Artists from across the Globe was a beautiful feeling."

349.title: No verdict on Gyanvapi Mosque case today, Muslim petitioners to be heard on May 26
349.article_body: The Varanasi district court, hearing the arguments on a civil suit on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Viswanath temple complex dispute, on Tuesday said it will hear the Muslim side that has sought to reject Hindus' civil suit seeking claim on the mosque.
