The next hearing is scheduled for May 26 (Thursday). The court did not give any verdict on Tuesday.

350.title: Didn't like 'Dil...' song, asked director 'How will one dance on this': Farah
350.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan said that she did not like the title track of 'Dil Bechara'. "I asked Mukesh [director], 'How will one dance on this?'. He reasoned, 'No, everyone has liked this song'...I was like, 'Let me do it in one shot. So in just one day, we'll complete the song shoot and I'll be free'," she added.

351.title: Tom Cruise 9 years older than me but looks younger: Jon Hamm
351.article_body: Actor Jon Hamm said that his 'Top Gun: Maverick' co-star Tom Cruise looks younger than him, adding that he doesn't know how that works. Tom, who is 59-years-old, is nine years older than Jon. Jon added that he was 15 when he first saw the film's prequel 'Top Gun', adding that he left the "heavy lifting" to the younger generation.

352.title: Agent says Heard kept 'Aquaman 2' role due to Jason Momoa: Report
352.article_body: Agent Kathryn Arnold testified in the ongoing defamation trial against Amber Heard filed by Johnny Depp. She stated Heard kept her "radically reduced" 'Aquaman 2' role because co-star Jason Momoa and director James Wan were "adamant she was in the film", reported Daily Mail. Kathryn reportedly said Momoa renegotiated his fee to $15 million but Heard was paid $2 million.

353.title: Rainfall, thundersquall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
353.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall over J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP, Rajasthan and MP today and tomorrow. It also predicted heavy rainfall over Odisha today and over Assam and Meghalaya on May 27 and 28 and widespread rain over Kerala and Puducherry for next five days. Thundersquall is predicted over Uttarakhand, Jharkhand, West Bengal and Odisha today.

354.title: OYO planning to launch $7-8 billion IPO after September: Report
354.article_body: OYO is planning to launch its IPO after September and has written to SEBI, seeking to file updated and restated consolidated financial information, PTI reported. The firm, which had earlier planned to raise $11 billion, is now reportedly prepared to settle for a lower valuation of $7-8 billion. OYO had last raised $5 million from Microsoft in August 2021.

355.title: Overcharged for water consumption by landlord, Nagpur couple dies by suicide
355.article_body: A couple allegedly died by suicide in Nagpur after being reportedly overcharged for water consumption by their landlord, police said on Monday.  The 45-year-old deceased who worked as a used vehicle dealer and his 40-year-old wife were the residents of Gauri Nagar in the Kalamna area of the city. Further investigation into the matter is underway, police said.

356.title: 4 dead, 5 injured as bus collides with truck in Rajasthan's Kota
356.article_body: A bus collided with a truck in Rajasthan's Kota leaving four passengers of the bus dead while five got injured. The deceased were identified as Virendra, Narayan, Jitendra Singh and Jitu. The driver of the bus, which had around 50 passengers, lost control after he stuck his neck out of the window to spit tobacco, police said.

357.title: Telangana Cong MLA criticises TRS on latter's RS candidate choice
357.article_body: Telangana Congress Working President Jagga Reddy has criticised the TRS government for reportedly nominating industrialist Bandi Parthasaradhi Reddy to the Rajya Sabha. "How can a person who committed a major scam is given a Rajya Sabha seat," asked Jagga. The Congress MLA further accused Parthasaradhi of indulging in the alleged Remdesivir medicine scam during the pandemic in the state.

358.title: Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss to testify after Amber's 'stairs' remark: Report
358.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss will reportedly be testifying in the actor's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. This comes after Amber had mentioned Moss being allegedly pushed down the stairs by Depp during her testimony. As per People magazine, Moss will testify in court via video link on Wednesday.  Moss and Depp dated in the 1990s.

359.title: If 2 co-stars go for coffee, it's reported they were 'spotted' together: Kartik
359.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said if two actors who are working together go out for coffee, it will be reported that they were "spotted" together. "People will begin to talk...Shall I stop going out? Or shall I look for secret spots? What if two people are meeting...just as friends? If four people go out...they'll publish photos of just two," he added.

360.title: Delhi to install AEDs in public places to prevent cardiac arrest deaths
360.article_body: Delhi government is planning to install automated external defibrillators (AEDs) in public places to ensure quick medical attention to people experiencing sudden cardiac arrests. AED is a medical device designed to analyse the heart rhythm and restore it to normal via controlled electric shocks. Officials said a mapping exercise would begin to identify possible locations in Delhi to install AEDs.

361.title: Hope UN rights chief's Xinjiang visit will clarify misinformation: China
361.article_body: Ahead of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights chief's visit to Xinjiang region, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said he hoped that Michelle Bachelet's visit would help "clarify misinformation". Beijing has been accused of unlawful treatment and forced labour of Uighurs and other Muslim minorities in Xinjiang. She's expected to visit Xinjiang's Urumqi and Kashgar cities on Tuesday and Wednesday.

362.title: Johnny Depp's severed finger story has flaws, claims hand surgeon
362.article_body: A hand surgeon testified Johnny Depp couldn't have lost his finger tip the way he said it happened. Surgeon Richard Moore, called by Amber Heard's team, said Depp described his palm was down on a bar when it was struck by bottle. Moore, who didn't treat Depp, said Depp's description is unlikely, in large part because his fingernail remained intact.

363.title: Putin survived assassination attempt 2 months ago: Ukraine spy chief
363.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin was attacked in an attempt to be killed around two months ago, shortly after the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the Chief of Defence Intelligence of Ukraine has said. The attempt on Putin's life was made in the Caucasus region, Kyrylo Budanov said. He called the attempt "absolutely unsuccessful".

364.title: Rahul Dravid took the call to not include Dhawan in India's T20I squad: Reports
364.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid took the call to not include Shikhar Dhawan in T20I squad for the series against South Africa, reports stated quoting a senior BCCI official. "In T20Is, you've to give chances to youngsters who have been doing well. We all agreed [with Rahul's decision]. Shikhar was informed by Rahul before the team announcement," the official stated.

365.title: Klarna doesn't exist in a bubble: CEO after firing 10% of startup's workforce
365.article_body: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski told employees the Swedish fintech startup "doesn't exist in a bubble" as he announced plans to fire about 10% of its global workforce. "When we set our business plans for 2022...it was a very different world," he wrote. "Since then, we've seen a tragic...war in Ukraine unfold...increase in inflation, a highly volatile stock market," Siemiatkowski added.

366.title: India looking to limit sugar exports, say reports; sugar companies' shares plunge
366.article_body: Shares of sugar companies plunged on Tuesday after reports said that Indian government is looking to limit sugar exports for the first time in six years to prevent a surge in domestic prices. Reuters reported the government could cap this season's exports at 10 million tonnes. India is the world's biggest sugar producer and the second biggest exporter behind Brazil.

367.title: Sonia Gandhi forms new groups, task force for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
367.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has formed a 'Political Affairs Group' that will be presided by her, a 'Task Force-2024' and a 'Central Planning Group' for the coordination of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Each member of the task force shall be assigned specific tasks related to organisation, communications and media, outreach, finance and election management," said the party.

368.title: 1,000 kg meat bought for wedding biryani seized due to bad quality in TN
368.article_body: The Food Safety Department in Tamil Nadu has seized 800 kg of spoiled mutton and 200 kg of chicken bought by a restaurant to prepare biryani for a wedding party in Tiruvarur. The caterers experienced a foul smell and the meat didn't cook properly. A food safety officer said the samples will be sent to a laboratory for testing.

369.title: Police to penalise people for storing bricks on rooftops in Bihar's Champaran
369.article_body: In order to prevent incidents of stone pelting, the West Champaran police in Bihar has decided to penalise people for storing bricks or stones on the rooftop of their houses. "We'll conduct aerial survey of the district. If bricks or stones are found on a rooftop...notice will immediately be served to...owner of the house seeking explanation," said SHO Rakesh Bhaskar.

370.title: Akshay Kumar recovers from COVID-19, resumes 'Prithviraj' promotions
370.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who was diagnosed with COVID-19 recently, has recovered from the virus. The actor has also resumed promotions for his film 'Prithviraj'. Akshay had shared the news of his diagnosis on May 14, saying, "Was really looking forward to rooting for our cinema at the India Pavilion at #Cannes2022, but have sadly tested positive for COVID."

371.title: India needs clear regulation for crypto investments: Binance exec
371.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance APAC Head Leon Foong in an interview discussing cryptocurrency investments in India said, "A clear, progressive, and pro-innovation regulatory framework is necessary in giving investors comfort and certainty that India is the right place to be putting their money." He added blockchain startups are what brought the attention of Binance and many investors in India.

372.title: Temple's character can't change with demolition: BJP leader
372.article_body: Amid the ongoing Gyanvapi mosque case, BJP leader and lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay said that a temple's religious character does not change after the demolition of roof, walls, pillars, foundation and even offering namaz. "After the 'pran pratishtha' of idol, a temple always remains a temple until the idol is shifted to another temple with the rituals of 'visharjan'," he added.

373.title: Cancel water theft FIRs against 32 farmers: SAD chief to Punjab CM
373.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal has asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to order the cancellation of water theft FIRs immediately that have been registered against 32 farmers in Fazilka. The irrigation department officials, who were "failing" in their duty to provide requisite water to farmers of the state, were "victimising" them, Badal said.

374.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla arrested on corruption charges
374.article_body: Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was on Tuesday arrested by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch following complaints of corruption against him. This comes after Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann dismissed Singla from the state Cabinet after receiving "concrete evidence" against him. Singla was allegedly demanding 1% commission from officials for contracts, according to the Chief Minister's Office.

375.title: Hindu deities used in building Qutub Minar complex but can't revive worship there: ASI
375.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India has told a Delhi court that though it is a fact that architectural images of Hindu and Jain deities were used in the construction of the Qutub Minar complex, revival of worship cannot be allowed. "Revival of worship is not allowed wherever it's not practiced at the time of protection of a monument," it said.

376.title: 20-yr-old man enters 43-yr-old TN woman's house, rapes her at knifepoint
376.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a 43-year-old woman at knifepoint after stalking her for two days in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Police said the incident took place on May 20. The man, who was following the woman all day, forcefully barged into her house when she returned from office. He sealed her mouth and raped her, police said.

377.title: 273 cylinders seized as police bust LPG refilling racket in Pune
377.article_body: Pune Rural Police have arrested four people as they busted a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) refilling racket on Monday. The police also recovered 273 cylinders which were stored illegally and unsafely in Shirur. The arrests were made after the police received a tip-off about the racket, which was being run from a makeshift facility built on a farm.

378.title: I'm crazy about Indian food, I love it to pieces: Jurassic Park actor Goldblum
378.article_body: Hollywood actor Jeff Goldblum, known for starring in films like 'Jurassic Park', 'The Grand Budapest Hotel' and 'Independence Day', has said he's "crazy about Indian food". "I love it to pieces," he added. "I eat too much of it when I have it because it is the most delicious food, I think, on Earth," Goldblum further said.

379.title: Du Plessis' powerplay strike rate is 104, it puts pressure on Kohli: Hogg
379.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis has a strike rate of 104 while batting in powerplay, adding that it puts pressure on Virat Kohli. "Kohli...is not at his best yet," stated Hogg. Talking about LSG captain KL Rahul, Hogg said Rahul's strike rate in powerplay isn't good enough and puts too much pressure on remaining batters.

380.title: I will definitely be with RCB next year, don't know in which capacity yet: AB de Villiers
380.article_body: Former South Africa and RCB wicketkeeper-batter AB de Villiers has said that he will definitely be around the IPL next year. "I will be [with] RCB next year...don't know in which capacity yet," he added. He further said, "I would love to return to my second home (Bengaluru) and I am looking forward to it."

381.title: Swedish fintech startup Klarna lays off 10% staff via prerecorded video message
381.article_body: Swedish fintech startup Klarna on Monday announced that it will lay off 10% of its 7,000 employees. In a prerecorded video message to the employees, CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski cited the Ukraine war, inflation, "shift in consumer sentiment" and a "highly volatile market" as the reason for layoffs. He added that employees in Europe will receive an "associated compensation".

382.title: 6 of family killed as lorry collides with mini-truck in Haryana's Jind
382.article_body: At least six members of a family and 17 others were injured after a lorry collided head-on with a mini-truck in which they were travelling in Haryana's Jind, police said. As many as 23 persons from the family in Hisar's Narnaund had gone to Haridwar to perform certain religious rites after the death of a family member, police added.

383.title: Confidence of opposition rises immensely on knowing they'll face RCB: Sehwag
383.article_body: Talking about RCB being knocked out in the Eliminator stage of IPL 2020 and IPL 2021, Virender Sehwag said, "The opposition's self confidence increases immensely when they come to know that they are playing RCB." "RCB try their best," added Sehwag. Sehwag jokingly stated that ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel didn't want RCB to qualify for the playoffs of IPL 2022.

384.title: Starlink will serve everywhere on Earth we're legally allowed: Musk
384.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking about Starlink's plans for Africa, said, "Starlink will serve everywhere on Earth that we're legally allowed to serve." The user had asked Musk if he had any plans for Starlink's entry to Africa, to which Musk replied, "Yes, first countries in Africa to be announced coming soon."

385.title: Iron shed collapses on workers as crane lifts it in Guj; 3 dead
385.article_body: Three workers were killed and four others critically injured after an iron shed at a rice mill factory in Gujarat's Ahmedabad collapsed on Monday. The incident occurred around 7 pm. The iron shed collapsed on the workers while it was being lifted by a crane, according to the police. The injured workers were taken to a hospital, an inspector said.

386.title: Qatar WC expected to be watched by 5 billion people: FIFA Prez
386.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has claimed that a global audience of 5 billion is expected to watch this year's football World Cup. "The last women's FIFA World Cup was watched by 1.2 billion people. This World Cup in Qatar will be watched by 5 billion people...way above half of the world's population," Infantino said.

387.title: Plea seeks FIR against Akhilesh, Owaisi for 'hurting religious sentiments'
387.article_body: A plea has been filed against AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav for allegedly "hurting religious sentiments" in name of the Gyanvapi Mosque case and the Kashi Vishwanath temple. Advocate Hari Shankar Pandey filed a petition in the Varanasi court seeking directions to the police to register FIR against seven people, including Yadav, Owaisi and his brother.

388.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 150 new electric AC buses
388.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flagged off 150 new AC electric buses today and said, "Please take care of them, don't make them dirty." "We launched 150 buses today, 150 more would be added next month. We aim to launch over 2,000 such buses within a year. Over next 10 years, ₹1,862 crore to be spent by Delhi government," Kejriwal said.

389.title: PIL in HC over equal status for 'Vande Mataram', 'Jana Gana Mana'
389.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Delhi High Court seeking a declaration that the poem 'Vande Mataram' will be "honoured equally" to the national anthem 'Jana Gana Mana'. The poem is a "symbol of our history, sovereignty, unity and pride", it said. If a citizen disrespects the poem, it'll "spell doom to all our rights", it added.

390.title: Employee among 3 arrested for burglary at jewellery shop in Bengaluru
390.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Monday arrested three people for stealing 8 kg of silver articles from a jewellery shop in Chamarajpete. According to police, one of the accused, identified as Rahul, worked at the shop. Rahul had opened two apparel shops in the city and incurred losses. He thus formulated a plan to steal from his employer's shop, police said.

391.title: Egyptian media tycoon jailed for sexually assaulting 7 orphan girls
391.article_body: An Egyptian court has sentenced businessman Mohamed el-Amin to three years in prison for sexually assaulting seven minor girls in an orphanage he founded. He has also been ordered to pay a fine of 200,000 Egyptian pounds (about $11,000). The tycoon, who founded several Egyptian media outlets, was arrested in January after allegations of sexual abuse at the orphanage surfaced.

392.title: Kerala becoming erstwhile Kashmir: BJP on provocative slogans at PFI rally
392.article_body: After a video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans during the Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala went viral, BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said, "[It] sounds very familiar to what we have heard numerous times in Kashmir...from...'tukde tukde' gang and at...demonstrations which were anti-national." "Kerala is moving towards becoming the erstwhile Kashmir," he added.

393.title: Rohit Shetty runs with 27 kg camera while filming 'Indian...', shares video
393.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty took to Instagram to share a video from set of 'Indian Police Force'. In the video, Rohit can be seen running with a camera, which he mentioned was 27 kg, while actor Sidharth Malhotra can be seen performing an action sequence. "It's weird how glass breaks...body hits...and staircase falls are normal for us!" Rohit wrote on Instagram.

394.title: I'm Hindu, will eat beef if I want to: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
394.article_body: Congress' Siddaramaiah said that he is a Hindu who had not consumed beef till now, but he would eat beef if he wanted to. "Beef eaters don't belong to just one community, even Hindus consume beef, Christians consume it as well...I have even said it in Karnataka Assembly. Who are you to tell me to not consume beef?" Siddaramaiah said.

395.title: EV cab platform BluSmart raises $25 mn in extended Series A round
395.article_body: Electric ride-hailing platform ﻿BluSmart﻿ has raised $25 million in an extended Series A round. The funding in the Series A1 round includes $15 million in equity capital, led by BP Ventures and Green Frontier Capital, and venture debt of $10 million. The venture debt funding came from Stride Ventures, Alteria Capital, BlackSoil and UCIC.

396.title: AAP dissolves its Goa working committee, says will reorganise
396.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) dissolved its Goa working committee on Monday, months after the conclusion of the Assembly elections. The party's state incharge Atishi said that the new committee will be reorganised soon. "With expansion of the party in mind…we will constitute a new committee to bring well-meaning and like-minded people into the party's fold," she said.

397.title: 22-year-old man robbed, murdered in Gurugram's IMT Manesar
397.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly murdered and dumped in the IMT Manesar area in Gurugram, police said. The incident took place when the victim was returning home after closing his shop in Aliar village. "The victim's phone was robbed. He suffered injuries on his face, back of the head, arms and back- all inflicted by a sharp object," police added.

398.title: Punjab CM dismisses state Health Minister Vijay Singla on charges of corruption
398.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has dismissed state Health Minister Vijay Singla following complaints of corruption against him. The Chief Minister's Office said Singla was demanding 1% commission from officials for contracts. Punjab CMO also said that concrete evidence has been found against him. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal had earlier asked public to record incident if someone asked for bribe.

399.title: Scientists in US start trial on vaccine that prevents pancreatic cancer
399.article_body: US scientists have started a vaccine trial that could prevent pancreatic cancer. Accordingly, a woman with family history of the disease has been given the first jab. Researchers hope the vaccine would equip her body with tools to identify rogue cells that may become cancerous and enable her immune system to launch search and destroy missions to prevent the disease.

400.title: Husband gets 10 years in jail in Kerala student's dowry death case
400.article_body: A Kollam court has sentenced S Kiran Kumar, the husband of Ayurveda medical student Vismaya V Nair who died by suicide in her marital home last year, to 10 years in jail. The court on Monday found him guilty of dowry death and abetting her suicide. Vismaya was 22 years old when she died by suicide on June 21, 2021.

401.title: Ram Gopal Varma booked for cheating a production house of ₹56 lakh
401.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has been booked by police in Hyderabad for allegedly cheating a production house to the tune of ₹56 lakh. This comes after Koppada Sekhar Raju of Sekhara Art Creations lodged a complaint alleging that Varma borrowed money for producing a movie titled 'Disha' with a promise to return the amount before its release but didn't repay.
